CatDescriptText: John H. Williams, elevator operator, Bedford, Pa., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "No, I do not. My guide, which has been effective in raising a family of six sons and six daughters, is that its all right for the offspring to ...smoking and other similar vices at the time they are able to start on their own, to support themselves."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John H. Williams wearing plaid shirt and light colored coat, standing in front of grocery store
